Ingredients:
- 3 cups sushi rice
- 3 cups water
- 1/2 cup rice vinegar
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 1/2 teaspoons salt
- 4 sheets of nori seaweed
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1/2 pound cooked shrimp, peeled and deveined
- Soy sauce and wasabi for serving

Instructions:

1. Rinse the sushi rice in cold water until the water runs clear. Drain the rice and put it in a saucepan with 3 cups of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the water has been absorbed and the rice is tender.

2. While the rice is cooking, heat the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small saucepan until the sugar has dissolved. Set aside to cool.

3. When the rice is done, transfer it to a large bowl and add the rice vinegar mixture. Stir well to combine, then let the rice cool to room temperature.

4. Cut the avocado in half and remove the pit. Slice the avocado into thin strips.

5. Lay a sheet of nori seaweed onto a sushi mat or a clean kitchen towel.

6. Spread a thin layer of rice over the nori, leaving a few inches at the top uncovered.

7. Place a row of sliced avocado and shrimp along the bottom edge of the rice.

8. Using the mat or towel as a guide, roll the sushi tightly from the bottom to the top, using your fingers to keep the fillings in place.

9. Repeat with the remaining nori, rice, avocado, and shrimp.

10. Use a sharp knife to cut each sushi roll into slices.

11. Serve with soy sauce and wasabi on the side.

Enjoy your homemade sushi rolls with shrimp and avocado!
